clinical_study.brief_title: Hemodynamic Repercussions of the Correction (Surgical and Non Surgical) of Pectus Excavatum-type Thoracic Deformities
clinical_study.official_title: Hemodynamic Repercussions of the Correction (Surgical and Non Surgical) of Pectus Excavatum-type Thoracic Deformities

brief_summary.textblock: this non-randomized prospective study of 2 longitudinal cohorts (surgical treatment group or orthopedic treatment group), will evaluate the hemodynamic repercussions of the correction (surgical and non surgical) of pectus excavatum-type thoracic deformities by measuring the cardiac output difference before and after intervention, measured by transthoracic impedancemetry, during an exercise stress test

primary_outcome.measure: Cardiac output difference before and after intervention,during an exercise stress test
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 months before treatment (initial evaluation E1) just before treatment (intermediate evaluation E2) and 4 months after surgical treatment (TC) or orthopedic treatment (TO) of the deformation (final evaluation E3)
primary_outcome.description: Cardiac output measured by transthoracic impedancemetry, during an exercise stress test

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients seeking treatment of a pectus excavatum
- Haller index > 3.2
- Desire for treatment
- age between 15 and 40 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cognitive impairment
- Pregnancy
- Contraindication to exercise stress test or general anesthesia
- Coagulation disorders
